ifm_schema.description: Common interface management. It includes the public configuration of interfaces.

statistic-interval.description: Set the interval at which global flow statistics are collected.

ipv4-ignore-primary-sub.description: Enable/disable the function of ignoring primary/secondary of IPv4 address type. All secondary addresses must be deleted before this function is enabled.

sub-interface-link-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on all Sub-interface.

damp.description: Enable/disable suppression on interfaces' physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable interfaces from sending signals if the interfaces' physical status flappings are suppressed.

auto-recovery-times.description: List of automatic recovery time configuration.

time-value.description: Delay for the status transition from down to up.

interfaces.description: List of configuring information on an interface.

interface.description: Configure information on an interface. Physical, NULL, Virtual-if, and Virtual-Template0 interfaces cannot be created or deleted.

name.description: The textual name of the interface. It should be the name of the interface as assigned by the local device. It should be suitable for use in commands which entered at the device's 'console'. This might be a text name, such as 'NULL0', depending on the interface naming syntax of the device.

class.description: Identify a main interface or a sub-interface.

type.description: Type of an interface. Interfaces include physical and logical interfaces.

parent-name.description: Name of the main interface. For example, Ethernet0/1/0.

number.description: Number of an interface. For example,1, 0/1/0, or 2:1.

admin-status.description: Administrative status of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-protocol.description: Link protocol. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

router-type.description: Route attribute of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

clear-ip-df.description: Enable/disable a device to forcibly fragment IP packets on an outbound interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-up-down-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable the statistics function on an interface. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-mode.description: Mode of statistics collection. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-type.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth-mbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-kbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.
Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mtu.description:
Maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface types.
Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the MTU value of main interface to subinterface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-interval.description: Interval at which flow statistics are collected on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

vrf-name.description: Name of a VPN instance. It uniquely identifies a VPN instance. The VRF name of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

l2-mode-enable.description: Enable/disable the function of creating an L2 Sub-interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mac-address.description: Config MAC Address. Constraints on MAC address configuration varies according to interfaces. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

position.description: Position of an interface. For example, 0/1/0. Data can be queried only on physical interfaces.

is-l2-switch.description: To identify a layer2 switch port.

vs-name.description: Name of a VS to which an interface belongs.

l2-switch-port-index.description: L2 switch port index of an interface.

protocol-up-delay-time.description: Specify the protocol up-delay-time value in seconds.

control-flap.description: Enable/disable flapping control on an interface.

suppress.description: Suppression threshold on an interface. The value must be greater than the reusing threshold and smaller than the suppression upper limit.

reuse.description: Reusing threshold of an interface. The value must be smaller than the suppression threshold.

ceiling.description: Maximum suppression value on an interface. The value should be greater than the damping suppression threshold.

decay-ok.description: The penalty value of an Up interface attenuates to 1/2.

decay-ng.description: The penalty value of a Down interface attenuates to 1/2.

control-flap-count.description: Status suppression count of an interface.

ignore-damp.description: Configure an interface to ignore the global damp-interface function.

ignore-global-damp.description: Enable/disable an interface to ignore the global damp-interface function.

damp.description: Enable/disable suppression on an interface's physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable an interface suppressed due to status flapping from sending signals.

damp-state.description: Operational state of interface suppression information.

ipv4-status.description: IPv4 Protocol status of an interface.

ipv6-status.description: IPv6 protocol status of an interface.

sub-if-counts.description: Number of sub-interfaces on this interface.

receive-byte.description: Number of bytes received on an interface.

send-byte.description: Number of bytes sent on an interface.

receive-packet.description: Number of packets received on an interface.

send-packet.description: Number of packets sent on an interface.

receive-unicast-packet.description: Number of unicast packets received on an interface.

receive-multicast-packet.description: Number of multicast packets received on an interface.

receive-broad-packet.description: Number of broadcast packets received on an interface.

send-unicast-packet.description: Number of unicast packets sent on an interface.

send-multicast-packet.description: Number of multicast packets sent on an interface.

send-broad-packet.description: Number of broadcast packets sent on an interface.

receive-error-packet.description: Number of error packets received on an interface.

receive-drop-packet.description: Number of received packets discarded on an interface.

send-error-packet.description: Number of error packets sent on an interface.

send-drop-packet.description: Number of sent packets discarded on an interface.

stati-interval.description: Current interval at which interface flow statistics are collected.

in-byte-rate.description: Rate at which bytes are received within the interval.

in-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are received within the interval.

in-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are received within the interval.

in-use-rate.description: Input bandwidth usage within the interval.

out-byte-rate.description: Rate at which bytes are sent within the interval.

out-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are sent within the interval.

out-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are sent within the interval.

out-use-rate.description: Output bandwidth usage within the interval.

receive-byte.description: Number of received bytes, which can be cleared.

send-byte.description: Number of sent bytes, which can be cleared.

receive-packet.description: Number of received packets, which can be cleared.

send-packet.description: Number of sent packets, which can be cleared.

receive-unicast-packet.description: Number of received unicast packets, which can be cleared.

receive-multicast-packet.description: Number of received multicast packets, which can be cleared.

receive-broad-packet.description: Number of received broadcast packets, which can be cleared.

send-unicast-packet.description: Number of sent unicast packets, which can be cleared.

send-multicast-packet.description: Number of sent multicast packets, which can be cleared.

send-broad-packet.description: Number of sent broadcast packets, which can be cleared.

receive-error-packet.description: Number of received error packets, which can be cleared.

receive-drop-packet.description: Number of received discarded packets, which can be cleared.

send-error-packet.description: Number of sent error packets, which can be cleared.

send-drop-packet.description: Number of sent discarded packets, which can be cleared.

send-unicast-bit.description: Number of unicast bits sent on an interface.

receive-unicast-bit.description: Number of unicast bits received on an interface.

send-multicast-bit.description: Number of multicast bits sent on an interface.

receive-multicast-bit.description: Number of multicast bits received on an interface.

send-broad-bit.description: Number of broadcast bits sent on an interface.

receive-broad-bit.description: Number of broadcast bits received on an interface.

send-unicast-bit-rate.description: Rate of unicast bits sent on an interface.

receive-unicast-bit-rate.description: Rate of unicast bits received on an interface.

send-multicast-bit-rate.description: Rate of multicast bits sent on an interface.

receive-multicast-bit-rate.description: Rate of multicast bits received on an interface.

send-broad-bit-rate.description: Rate of broadcast bits sent on an interface.

receive-broad-bit-rate.description: Rate of broadcast bits received on an interface.

send-unicast-packet-rate.description: Rate of unicast packets sent on an interface.

receive-unicast-packet-rate.description: Rate of unicast packets received on an interface.

send-multicast-packet-rate.description: Rate of multicast packets sent on an interface.

receive-multicast-packet-rate.description: Rate of multicast packets received on an interface.

send-broadcast-packet-rate.description: Rate of broadcast packets sent on an interface.

receive-broadcast-packet-rate.description: Rate of broadcast packets received on an interface.

error-down.description: Information about the interface in the error-down state, including the interface name, cause of the error-down event, delay for the transition from down to up, and remaining time for the up state.

recovery-time.description: Delay for the transition from down to up.

remainder-time.description: The remaining time for the up event.

ucmp.description: Enable/disable UCMP on an interface. To implement UCMP on equal-cost links with different bandwidth values, you can configure this function on each interface. Enabling or disabling UCMP on a physical interface takes effect only after the interface is restarted. UCMP is only for equal-cost routes. UCMP applies only to equal-cost routes and is independent of routing protocols, such as an IGP or BGP.

packet.description: Enable/disable per-packet load balancing on specified interfaces.

tunnel-protocol.description:
Configure tunnel protocol.
Special explanation:
Constraint: If a tunnel is locked, all configurations of the tunnel cannot be deleted or modified.

type.description: Tunnel interface link layer encapsulation protocol type.

tunnel-id.description:
Session ID of a tunnel.
Special explanation:
Range: The min value of MPLSTunnelIndex leaf is 1, and max value is dynamic.

egress-lsr-id.description: Specifies egress LSR ID of the tunnel.

reserved-for-binding.description: Enable/disable the tunnel can transmit only the service of the specified VPN.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable TE tunnel interface statistic enabling state.

rsvp-te.description: Configure TE E2E Dynamic unicast tunnel.

signalled-tunnel-name.description: User Defined el Name, use tunnel interface name as default. The first character cannot be numbers. And cannot use physical interface name.

class-type.description: The class type for IETF mode.

setup-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.

hold-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.

ordinary-enable.description: Enable/disable a tunnel ordinary backup protection capability. When it is enabled, and the primary LSP fails, a backup LSP that meets certain limits will be set up. Then, the traffic on the primary LSP will be switched to the backup LSP.

best-effort-enable.description: Enable/disable best-effort path protection of tunnels. When best-effort path is enabled for a TE tunnel, and both active and standby LSP fail, a LSP will be set up in the best effort method.

backup-frr-inuse.description: Enable/disable the capability of creating backup lsp during frr in use. When configured fast-reroute and backup protection, and the tunnel is down, it will switch to frr-in-use, and it will try to restore the primary LSP, if you configure this capability, the same time, it will try to create backup LSP. This capability depends on configuration of enabling hot-standby or ordinary.

path-disjoint-calculate.description: Enable/disable the capability of calculate fully disjoint path for main and hot-standby.

record-route.description: Route record mode of a tunnel.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

inter-area-reoptimization.description: Enable/disable inter-area reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a tunnel with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

metric-inherit-igp.description: Enable/disable the TE tunnel metric inherits the IGP metric.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

split-tunnel.description: Enable/disable the RSVP-TE tunnel as a split tunnel.

self-ping.description: Self-ping enabling state of an RSVP-TE tunnel.

self-ping-duration.description: Self-ping timeout period of an RSVP-TE tunnel. Value 65535 indicates no limit on the detection time.

fast-reroute.description: Configure fast reroute attribute of a Tunnel.

mode.description: The tunnel with fast reroute mode.

bandwidth-protection-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel with fast reroute capability requests bandwidth protection.

frr-switch-degrade.description: Enable/disable fast reroute tunnel degrade capability.

frr-bandwidth.description: FRR-protection bandwidth (kbits/s) requested by an active tunnel. The value cannot exceed the bandwidth of the active tunnel.

setup-priority.description:
Setup priority of FRR-protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel setup priority cannot exceed the setup priority of the active tunnel.

hold-priority.description:
Holding priority of FRR protection tunnels. The value 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel holding priority cannot exceed the active tunnel holding priority.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

revertive-mode.description: Hot-standby revertive. There are two revert modes, e.g. revertive and non-revertive. The default mode is revertive.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP can overlap primary LSP. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

lsp-paths.description: List of LSP path of a tunnel.

lsp-path.description: Configure LSP path of a tunnel. Four roles are available.

path-type.description: Path role of a tunnel. The available options are primary (used by primary LSP), hot-standby (used by hot-standby backup LSP), ordinary (used by ordinary backup LSP), and best-effort (used by best-effort LSP).

explicit-path-name.description: Referenced explicit path by the tunnel. The name is case-insensitive.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a TE LSP.

lsp-id.description: LSP ID of a tunnel path.

modify-lsp-id.description: Modified LSP ID of a tunnel path.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

enable.description:
Enable/disable bypass tunnel capability. A bypass tunnel can be enabled to protect a tunnel that requests FRR protection.
Special explanation:
Constraint: A bypass tunnel cannot request FRR protection.

items.description: Configure interface that can be protected by a bypass tunnel.

wtr-state.description: Whether the hot-standby WTR timer is running.

switch-reason.description: The reason of hot-stanby LSP switch.

lsps.description: List of LSPs of a tunnel.

lsp.description: Statistics of LSP of a tunnel.

ingress-lsr-id.description: Ingress LSR ID.

tunnel-role.description: Specifies the types of the LSP nodes.

incoming-interface-name.description: LSP incoming interface name. The name is case-insensitive.

outgoing-interface-name.description: LSP outgoing interface name. The name is case-insensitive.

setup-priority.description: Setup priority of a LSP.

hold-priority.description: Hold priority of a LSP.

record-route.description: Route record mode.

dste-mode.description: Whether DS-TE is used for LSP bandwidth constraints.

explicit-path-name.description: Explicit path name of a LSP. The name is case-insensitive.

include-all.description: Specifies the Include-all (management group attribute) of a LSP.

include-any.description: Specifies the Include-any (management group attribute) of a LSP.

exclude-any.description: Specifies the Exclude-any (management group attribute) of a LSP.

local-protect-enable.description: Specifies the enabling or disabling state of FRR for a LSP.

local-protect-inuse.description: Specifies the FRR protection state of this LSP.

bypass-tunnel-name.description: Specifies the name of the bypass tunnel that protects the LSP. The name is case-insensitive.

permit-bandwidth-share.description: Indicates whether the LSP permits bandwidth sharing.

entropy-label.description: LSP Entropy Label Capability Negotiation Result.

ar-hops.description: List of actual path of a LSP.

ar-hop.description: Statistics of actual hop of a LSP.

incomming-type.description: Whether the hop is an inbound interface.

ip-address.description: IP address of the actual hop.

auto-bandwidths.description: Configure auto bandwidth configuration of a tunnel.

mode.description: Auto bandwidth mode.

threshold-percent.description: Set the threshold of the adjustment bandwidth.

threshold-absolute.description: Set the absolute minimum bandwidth of the adjustment bandwidth.

threshold-logic.description: Set thresholds to adjust the bandwidth of the threshold absolute value and percentage of the effective logic.

bit-error-detection.description: Configure bit error detection of LSP.

bit-error-switch.description: Enable/disable bit error detection switch capability.

detection-mode.description: Specifies the switch mode. Include unidirectional switching and bidirectional switching.

switch-threshold-coe-value.description: Specifies the coefficient value of switch-threshold.

switch-threshold-pow-value.description: Specifies the power value of switch-threshold.

resume-threshold-coe-value.description: Specifies the coefficient value of resume-threshold.

resume-threshold-pow-value.description: Specifies the power value of resume-threshold.

reverse-lsp.description: Configure reverse LSP of TE tunnel.

ingress-lsr-id.description: LSP id of a backward tunnel path.

tunnel-id.description: Session id of a backward tunnel.

ingress-lsr-id.description: Specifies ingress LSR ID of the tunnel.

admin-status.description: Interface administrative status. The available options are Up and Down.

oper-status.description: Interface operation status. The available options are Up and Down.

active-lsp-type.description: Type of LSP that is transmitting traffic.

working-lsp-id.description: The working LSP ID of a Tunnel.

current-collect-bandwith.description: Existing collected bandwidth in automatic bandwidth adjustment.

auto-bandwidth-remain-time.description: Remaining time of automatic bandwidth adjustment.

setup-priority.description:
Specifies a tunnel setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The setup priority of a tunnel must be equal to or smaller than its holding priority.

hold-priority.description:
Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The holding priority of a tunnel must be equal to or larger than its setup priority.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

split-tunnel.description: Enable/disable an SR-TE tunnel as a split tunnel.

binding-sid.description: Working binding SID of a Tunnel.

reverse-binding-sid.description: The working reverse binding SID of a LSP.

adjacency-sid.description: Enable/disable SR-TE tunnel CSPF path select label type adjacency.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization of TE Tunnel.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr-time.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. Its range is 0~2592000, default is 10. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP overlap capability. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

lsp-paths.description: List of path configuration of a SR-TE tunnel.

lsp-path.description: Configure LSP path of a SR-TE tunnel. Two roles are available.

type.description: Path role of a tunnel. The available options are primary (used by primary LSP), hot-standby (used by hot-standby backup LSP).

explicit-path-name.description: Referenced explicit path by the tunnel. The name is case-insensitive.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a SR-MPLS TE LSP. If the default value (32) is used in the hop-limit, both adjacency and node SIDs can be used for local SR-MPLS TE path calculation. If a non-default value (1-31) is used in the hop-limit, only adjacency SIDs can be used for local SR-MPLS TE path computation.

lsp-id.description: LSP ID of a tunnel path.

modify-lsp-id.description: Modified LSP ID of a tunnel path.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

wtr-state.description: Whether the hot-standby WTR timer is running.

using-overlap.description: Whether the primary and HSB LSPs overlap.

switch-reason.description: The reason of hot-stanby LSP switch.

ingress-lsr-id.description: Specifies ingress LSR ID of the tunnel.

working-lsp-id.description: The working LSP ID of a Tunnel.

current-collect-bandwith.description: Existing collected bandwidth in automatic bandwidth adjustment.

auto-bandwidth-remain-time.description: Remaining time of automatic bandwidth adjustment.

lsps.description: List of LSPs for SR-TE Tunnel.

lsp.description: Statistics of LSP for SR-TE Tunnel.

ingress-lsr-id.description: Ingress LSR ID.

c-hops.description: List of path calculated by PCE according to LSP constraints.

c-hop.description: Statistics of path calculated by PCE according to LSP constraints.

type.description: Hop type calculated by PCE or CSPF. The available options are strict and loose.

tunnel-last-errors.description: List of tunnel last error information.

tunnel-last-error.description: Statistics of tunnel last error information.

pipe-mode.description: Specifies the pipe mode of TE tunnel.

mpls-tunnel-service-class.description: Configure specifies the service class of te tunnel.

ipv4-dscp-value.description: IPv4 DSCP, in the format of 0,1,2,3-10,63. A DSCP value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.Entering an asterisk (*) deletes DSCP configuration.

ipv6-dscp-value.description: IPv6 DSCP, in the format of 0,1,2,3-10,63. A DSCP value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.Entering an asterisk (*) deletes DSCP configuration.

damping-time.description: Delay time after which a VLANIF interface goes down.

address.description: The IPv4 address can be specified as negotiated or unnumbered or ordinarily address.

addresses.description: List of common addresses. The IPv4 address of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

unnumbered-address.description: Configure unnumbered interface. The address borrowing relationship of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

is-block.description: IPv4 address is blocked or not.

ipv6.description: Enable/disable the IPv6 capability on an interface.

mtu6.description:
IPv6 maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface's type.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the IPv6 MTU of main interface to subinterface.

auto-link-local.description: Enable/disable an interface with the auto linklocal address function.

prefix-length.description: Length of the IPv6 address prefix.

mtu6.description:
IPv6 maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface's type.

prefix-length.description: Length of the IPv6 address prefix.

is-block.description: IPv6 address is blocked or not.

vlan-swap.description: Enable or disable VLAN tag swapping.

trunk-vlans.description: List of VLANs that are allowed to pass.

untag-vlans.description: List of untagged VLANs that are allowed to pass.

stacking-vlan.description: VLAN ID in the outer VLAN tag after VLAN stacking is performed.

ce-default.description: Add a VLAN tag to received untagged packets.

trans-vlans.description: List of VLAN IDs of received packets. VLANs are used to control traffic access. Only one VLAN can be configured on an interface and all its sub-interfaces.

vlan-stacking-remarks.description: List of VLAN stacking with remark.

vlan-stacking-remark.description: Configure VLAN stacking interface with remark 8021p.

mapping-vlan.description: VLAN ID in the VLAN tag after VLAN mapping is performed.

trans-vlans.description: List of VLAN IDs in VLAN tags before VLAN mapping is performed.

vlan-mapping-remarks.description: List of VLAN mapping with remark.

vlan-mapping-remark.description: Configure VLAN mapping interface with remark 8021p.

vlans.description: VLAN list. The specified VLAN must have been added to an interface.

mode.description: Include single and multiple modes. The mode cannot be modified after being referenced.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable VLAN group-based QinQ packet statistics.

flow-type.description: Specify an encapsulation type. After an encapsulation type is specified, it cannot be changed to another encapsulation type. In addition, it can not be deleted if a service has been configured in the same interface. If an encapsulation type fails to be specified, see the error message to determine the failure cause.

vlan-type-vid.description: VLAN ID of the VLAN sub-interface;

dot1q-vlans.description: List of dot1q termination configuration. When tag-type is rt-protocol, this node can only configure one VLAN.

vlan-list.description: Dot1q termination VLAN ID list.
Dot1q termination VLAN ID list. The VLAN in VLAN-list can not exist in../../dot1q-VLANs-group/VLAN-list.

policy-vlan-groups.description: List of sub-interface policy VLAN with gorup.

vrrps.description: Configure dot1q VRRP list. VLAN-id must be configured on the interface.

pwtag.description: Configure the P-Tag of the packets in the PW with VLAN.

tag.description: Tag type, include local switching, rt-protocol and none type, this value can not be merged.

remainder-time.description: The remaining time for the up event.

ucmp.description: Enable/disable UCMP on an interface. To implement UCMP on equal-cost links with different bandwidth values, you can configure this function on each interface. Enabling or disabling UCMP on a physical interface takes effect only after the interface is restarted. UCMP is only for equal-cost routes. UCMP applies only to equal-cost routes and is independent of routing protocols, such as an IGP or BGP.

packet.description: Enable/disable per-packet load balancing on specified interfaces.

tunnel-protocol.description:
Configure tunnel protocol.
Special explanation:
Constraint: If a tunnel is locked, all configurations of the tunnel cannot be deleted or modified.

type.description: Tunnel interface link layer encapsulation protocol type.

tunnel-id.description:
Session ID of a tunnel.
Special explanation:
Range: The min value of MPLSTunnelIndex leaf is 1, and max value is dynamic.

egress-lsr-id.description: Specifies egress LSR ID of the tunnel.

reserved-for-binding.description: Enable/disable the tunnel can transmit only the service of the specified VPN.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable TE tunnel interface statistic enabling state.

rsvp-te.description: Configure TE E2E Dynamic unicast tunnel.

signalled-tunnel-name.description: User Defined el Name, use tunnel interface name as default. The first character cannot be numbers. And cannot use physical interface name.

class-type.description: The class type for IETF mode.

setup-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.

hold-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.

ordinary-enable.description: Enable/disable a tunnel ordinary backup protection capability. When it is enabled, and the primary LSP fails, a backup LSP that meets certain limits will be set up. Then, the traffic on the primary LSP will be switched to the backup LSP.

best-effort-enable.description: Enable/disable best-effort path protection of tunnels. When best-effort path is enabled for a TE tunnel, and both active and standby LSP fail, a LSP will be set up in the best effort method.

backup-frr-inuse.description: Enable/disable the capability of creating backup lsp during frr in use. When configured fast-reroute and backup protection, and the tunnel is down, it will switch to frr-in-use, and it will try to restore the primary LSP, if you configure this capability, the same time, it will try to create backup LSP. This capability depends on configuration of enabling hot-standby or ordinary.

path-disjoint-calculate.description: Enable/disable the capability of calculate fully disjoint path for main and hot-standby.

record-route.description: Route record mode of a tunnel.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

inter-area-reoptimization.description: Enable/disable inter-area reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a tunnel with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

metric-inherit-igp.description: Enable/disable the TE tunnel metric inherits the IGP metric.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

split-tunnel.description: Enable/disable the RSVP-TE tunnel as a split tunnel.

self-ping.description: Self-ping enabling state of an RSVP-TE tunnel.

self-ping-duration.description: Self-ping timeout period of an RSVP-TE tunnel. Value 65535 indicates no limit on the detection time.

fast-reroute.description: Configure fast reroute attribute of a Tunnel.

mode.description: The tunnel with fast reroute mode.

bandwidth-protection-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel with fast reroute capability requests bandwidth protection.

frr-switch-degrade.description: Enable/disable fast reroute tunnel degrade capability.

frr-bandwidth.description: FRR-protection bandwidth (kbits/s) requested by an active tunnel. The value cannot exceed the bandwidth of the active tunnel.

setup-priority.description:
Setup priority of FRR-protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel setup priority cannot exceed the setup priority of the active tunnel.

hold-priority.description:
Holding priority of FRR protection tunnels. The value 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel holding priority cannot exceed the active tunnel holding priority.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

revertive-mode.description: Hot-standby revertive. There are two revert modes, e.g. revertive and non-revertive. The default mode is revertive.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP can overlap primary LSP. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

lsp-paths.description: List of LSP path of a tunnel.

lsp-path.description: Configure LSP path of a tunnel. Four roles are available.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

Specifies a tunnel setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The setup priority of a tunnel must be equal to or smaller than its holding priority.

hold-priority.description:
Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The holding priority of a tunnel must be equal to or larger than its setup priority.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr-time.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. Its range is 0~2592000, default is 10. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP overlap capability. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a SR-MPLS TE LSP. If the default value (32) is used in the hop-limit, both adjacency and node SIDs can be used for local SR-MPLS TE path calculation. If a non-default value (1-31) is used in the hop-limit, only adjacency SIDs can be used for local SR-MPLS TE path computation.

error-down.description: Information about the interface in the error-down state, including the interface name, cause of the error-down event, delay for the transition from down to up, and remaining time for the up state.

recovery-time.description: Delay for the transition from down to up.

remainder-time.description: The remaining time for the up event.

ucmp.description: Enable/disable UCMP on an interface. To implement UCMP on equal-cost links with different bandwidth values, you can configure this function on each interface. Enabling or disabling UCMP on a physical interface takes effect only after the interface is restarted. UCMP is only for equal-cost routes. UCMP applies only to equal-cost routes and is independent of routing protocols, such as an IGP or BGP.

packet.description: Enable/disable per-packet load balancing on specified interfaces.

tunnel-protocol.description:
Configure tunnel protocol.
Special explanation:
Constraint: If a tunnel is locked, all configurations of the tunnel cannot be deleted or modified.

type.description: Tunnel interface link layer encapsulation protocol type.

tunnel-id.description:
Session ID of a tunnel.
Special explanation:
Range: The min value of MPLSTunnelIndex leaf is 1, and max value is dynamic.

egress-lsr-id.description: Specifies egress LSR ID of the tunnel.

reserved-for-binding.description: Enable/disable the tunnel can transmit only the service of the specified VPN.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable TE tunnel interface statistic enabling state.

rsvp-te.description: Configure TE E2E Dynamic unicast tunnel.

signalled-tunnel-name.description: User Defined el Name, use tunnel interface name as default. The first character cannot be numbers. And cannot use physical interface name.

class-type.description: The class type for IETF mode.

setup-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.

hold-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.

ordinary-enable.description: Enable/disable a tunnel ordinary backup protection capability. When it is enabled, and the primary LSP fails, a backup LSP that meets certain limits will be set up. Then, the traffic on the primary LSP will be switched to the backup LSP.

best-effort-enable.description: Enable/disable best-effort path protection of tunnels. When best-effort path is enabled for a TE tunnel, and both active and standby LSP fail, a LSP will be set up in the best effort method.

backup-frr-inuse.description: Enable/disable the capability of creating backup lsp during frr in use. When configured fast-reroute and backup protection, and the tunnel is down, it will switch to frr-in-use, and it will try to restore the primary LSP, if you configure this capability, the same time, it will try to create backup LSP. This capability depends on configuration of enabling hot-standby or ordinary.

path-disjoint-calculate.description: Enable/disable the capability of calculate fully disjoint path for main and hot-standby.

record-route.description: Route record mode of a tunnel.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

inter-area-reoptimization.description: Enable/disable inter-area reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a tunnel with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

metric-inherit-igp.description: Enable/disable the TE tunnel metric inherits the IGP metric.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

split-tunnel.description: Enable/disable the RSVP-TE tunnel as a split tunnel.

self-ping.description: Self-ping enabling state of an RSVP-TE tunnel.

self-ping-duration.description: Self-ping timeout period of an RSVP-TE tunnel. Value 65535 indicates no limit on the detection time.

fast-reroute.description: Configure fast reroute attribute of a Tunnel.

mode.description: The tunnel with fast reroute mode.

bandwidth-protection-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel with fast reroute capability requests bandwidth protection.

frr-switch-degrade.description: Enable/disable fast reroute tunnel degrade capability.

frr-bandwidth.description: FRR-protection bandwidth (kbits/s) requested by an active tunnel. The value cannot exceed the bandwidth of the active tunnel.

setup-priority.description:
Setup priority of FRR-protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel setup priority cannot exceed the setup priority of the active tunnel.

hold-priority.description:
Holding priority of FRR protection tunnels. The value 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel holding priority cannot exceed the active tunnel holding priority.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

revertive-mode.description: Hot-standby revertive. There are two revert modes, e.g. revertive and non-revertive. The default mode is revertive.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP can overlap primary LSP. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

lsp-paths.description: List of LSP path of a tunnel.

lsp-path.description: Configure LSP path of a tunnel. Four roles are available.

path-type.description: Path role of a tunnel. The available options are primary (used by primary LSP), hot-standby (used by hot-standby backup LSP), ordinary (used by ordinary backup LSP), and best-effort (used by best-effort LSP).

explicit-path-name.description: Referenced explicit path by the tunnel. The name is case-insensitive.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a TE LSP.

lsp-id.description: LSP ID of a tunnel path.

modify-lsp-id.description: Modified LSP ID of a tunnel path.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

Enable/disable bypass tunnel capability. A bypass tunnel can be enabled to protect a tunnel that requests FRR protection.

Constraint: A bypass tunnel cannot request FRR protection.

switch-reason.description: The reason of hot-stanby LSP switch.

include-any.description: Specifies the Include-any (management group attribute) of a LSP.

local-protect-inuse.description: Specifies the FRR protection state of this LSP.

bypass-tunnel-name.description: Specifies the name of the bypass tunnel that protects the LSP. The name is case-insensitive.

permit-bandwidth-share.description: Indicates whether the LSP permits bandwidth sharing.

entropy-label.description: LSP Entropy Label Capability Negotiation Result.

incomming-type.description: Whether the hop is an inbound interface.

threshold-absolute.description: Set the absolute minimum bandwidth of the adjustment bandwidth.

threshold-logic.description: Set thresholds to adjust the bandwidth of the threshold absolute value and percentage of the effective logic.

bit-error-detection.description: Configure bit error detection of LSP.

bit-error-switch.description: Enable/disable bit error detection switch capability.

detection-mode.description: Specifies the switch mode. Include unidirectional switching and bidirectional switching.

switch-threshold-coe-value.description: Specifies the coefficient value of switch-threshold.

resume-threshold-coe-value.description: Specifies the coefficient value of resume-threshold.

oper-status.description: Interface operation status. The available options are Up and Down.

setup-priority.description:
Specifies a tunnel setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The setup priority of a tunnel must be equal to or smaller than its holding priority.

hold-priority.description:
Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The holding priority of a tunnel must be equal to or larger than its setup priority.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

split-tunnel.description: Enable/disable an SR-TE tunnel as a split tunnel.

binding-sid.description: Working binding SID of a Tunnel.

reverse-binding-sid.description: The working reverse binding SID of a LSP.

adjacency-sid.description: Enable/disable SR-TE tunnel CSPF path select label type adjacency.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization of TE Tunnel.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr-time.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. Its range is 0~2592000, default is 10. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP overlap capability. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

lsp-paths.description: List of path configuration of a SR-TE tunnel.

lsp-path.description: Configure LSP path of a SR-TE tunnel. Two roles are available.

type.description: Path role of a tunnel. The available options are primary (used by primary LSP), hot-standby (used by hot-standby backup LSP).

explicit-path-name.description: Referenced explicit path by the tunnel. The name is case-insensitive.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a SR-MPLS TE LSP. If the default value (32) is used in the hop-limit, both adjacency and node SIDs can be used for local SR-MPLS TE path calculation. If a non-default value (1-31) is used in the hop-limit, only adjacency SIDs can be used for local SR-MPLS TE path computation.

modify-lsp-id.description: Modified LSP ID of a tunnel path.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

ipv6-dscp-value.description: IPv6 DSCP, in the format of 0,1,2,3-10,63. A DSCP value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.Entering an asterisk (*) deletes DSCP configuration.

damping-time.description: Delay time after which a VLANIF interface goes down.

address.description: The IPv4 address can be specified as negotiated or unnumbered or ordinarily address.

IPv6 maximum transmission unit of an interface.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the IPv6 MTU of main interface to subinterface.

IPv6 maximum transmission unit of an interface.

ucmp.description: Enable/disable UCMP on an interface. To implement UCMP on equal-cost links with different bandwidth values, you can configure this function on each interface. Enabling or disabling UCMP on a physical interface takes effect only after the interface is restarted. UCMP is only for equal-cost routes. UCMP applies only to equal-cost routes and is independent of routing protocols, such as an IGP or BGP.

Enabling or disabling UCMP on a physical interface takes effect only after the interface is restarted. UCMP is only for equal-cost routes. hold-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.

ordinary-enable.description: Enable/disable a tunnel ordinary backup protection capability. When it is enabled, and the primary LSP fails, a backup LSP that meets certain limits will be set up. Then, the traffic on the primary LSP will be switched to the backup LSP.

best-effort-enable.description: Enable/disable best-effort path protection of tunnels. When best-effort path is enabled for a TE tunnel, and both active and standby LSP fail, a LSP will be set up in the best effort method.

backup-frr-inuse.description: Enable/disable the capability of creating backup lsp during frr in use. When configured fast-reroute and backup protection, and the tunnel is down, it will switch to frr-in-use, and it will try to restore the primary LSP, if you configure this capability, the same time, it will try to create backup LSP. This capability depends on configuration of enabling hot-standby or ordinary.

path-disjoint-calculate.description: Enable/disable the capability of calculate fully disjoint path for main and hot-standby.

record-route.description: Route record mode of a tunnel.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

inter-area-reoptimization.description: Enable/disable inter-area reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a tunnel with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

metric-inherit-igp.description: Enable/disable the TE tunnel metric inherits the IGP metric.

bandwidth-protection-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel with fast reroute capability requests bandwidth protection.

frr-switch-degrade.description: Enable/disable fast reroute tunnel degrade capability.

frr-bandwidth.description: FRR-protection bandwidth (kbits/s) requested by an active tunnel. The value cannot exceed the bandwidth of the active tunnel.

setup-priority.description:
Setup priority of FRR-protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel setup priority cannot exceed the setup priority of the active tunnel.

hold-priority.description:
Holding priority of FRR protection tunnels. The value 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel holding priority cannot exceed the active tunnel holding priority.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

revertive-mode.description: Hot-standby revertive. There are two revert modes, e.g. revertive and non-revertive. The default mode is revertive.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP can overlap primary LSP. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

lsps.description: List of LSPs for SR-TE Tunnel.

lsp.description: Statistics of LSP for SR-TE Tunnel.

ingress-lsr-id.description: Ingress LSR ID.

c-hops.description: List of path calculated by PCE according to LSP constraints.

c-hop.description: Statistics of path calculated by PCE according to LSP constraints.

type.description: Hop type calculated by PCE or CSPF. The available options are strict and loose.

tunnel-last-errors.description: List of tunnel last error information.

tunnel-last-error.description: Statistics of tunnel last error information.

pipe-mode.description: Specifies the pipe mode of TE tunnel.

mpls-tunnel-service-class.description: Configure specifies the service class of te tunnel.

ipv4-dscp-value.description: IPv4 DSCP, in the format of 0,1,2,3-10,63. A DSCP value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.Entering an asterisk (*) deletes DSCP configuration.

ipv6-dscp-value.description: IPv6 DSCP, in the format of 0,1,2,3-10,63. A DSCP value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.Entering an asterisk (*) deletes DSCP configuration.

tunnel-id.description:
Session ID of a tunnel.
Special explanation:
Range: The min value of MPLSTunnelIndex leaf is 1, and max value is dynamic.

egress-lsr-id.description: Specifies egress LSR ID of the tunnel.

reserved-for-binding.description: Enable/disable the tunnel can transmit only the service of the specified VPN.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable TE tunnel interface statistic enabling state.

rsvp-te.description: Configure TE E2E Dynamic unicast tunnel.

signalled-tunnel-name.description: User Defined el Name, use tunnel interface name as default. The first character cannot be numbers. And cannot use physical interface name.

class-type.description: The class type for IETF mode.

setup-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.

hold-priority.description: Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.

ordinary-enable.description: Enable/disable a tunnel ordinary backup protection capability. When it is enabled, and the primary LSP fails, a backup LSP that meets certain limits will be set up. Then, the traffic on the primary LSP will be switched to the backup LSP.

best-effort-enable.description: Enable/disable best-effort path protection of tunnels. When best-effort path is enabled for a TE tunnel, and both active and standby LSP fail, a LSP will be set up in the best effort method.

backup-frr-inuse.description: Enable/disable the capability of creating backup lsp during frr in use. When configured fast-reroute and backup protection, and the tunnel is down, it will switch to frr-in-use, and it will try to restore the primary LSP, if you configure this capability, the same time, it will try to create backup LSP. This capability depends on configuration of enabling hot-standby or ordinary.

path-disjoint-calculate.description: Enable/disable the capability of calculate fully disjoint path for main and hot-standby.

record-route.description: Route record mode of a tunnel.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

inter-area-reoptimization.description: Enable/disable inter-area reoptimization enabling state of TE Tunnel.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a tunnel with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

metric-inherit-igp.description: Enable/disable the TE tunnel metric inherits the IGP metric.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

split-tunnel.description: Enable/disable the RSVP-TE tunnel as a split tunnel.

self-ping.description: Self-ping enabling state of an RSVP-TE tunnel.

self-ping-duration.description: Self-ping timeout period of an RSVP-TE tunnel. Value 65535 indicates no limit on the detection time.

fast-reroute.description: Configure fast reroute attribute of a Tunnel.

mode.description: The tunnel with fast reroute mode.

bandwidth-protection-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel with fast reroute capability requests bandwidth protection.

frr-switch-degrade.description: Enable/disable fast reroute tunnel degrade capability.

frr-bandwidth.description: FRR-protection bandwidth (kbits/s) requested by an active tunnel. The value cannot exceed the bandwidth of the active tunnel.

setup-priority.description:
Setup priority of FRR-protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel setup priority cannot exceed the setup priority of the active tunnel.

hold-priority.description:
Holding priority of FRR protection tunnels. The value 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel holding priority cannot exceed the active tunnel holding priority.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute of FRR protection tunnel: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

revertive-mode.description: Hot-standby revertive. There are two revert modes, e.g. revertive and non-revertive. The default mode is revertive.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP can overlap primary LSP. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

lsp-paths.description: List of LSP path of a tunnel.

lsp-path.description: Configure LSP path of a tunnel. Four roles are available.

path-type.description: Path role of a tunnel. The available options are primary (used by primary LSP), hot-standby (used by hot-standby backup LSP), ordinary (used by ordinary backup LSP), and best-effort (used by best-effort LSP).

explicit-path-name.description: Referenced explicit path by the tunnel. The name is case-insensitive.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a TE LSP.

lsp-id.description: LSP ID of a tunnel path.

modify-lsp-id.description: Modified LSP ID of a tunnel path.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

enable.description:
Enable/disable bypass tunnel capability. A bypass tunnel can be enabled to protect a tunnel that requests FRR protection.
Special explanation:
Constraint: A bypass tunnel cannot request FRR protection.

items.description: Configure interface that can be protected by a bypass tunnel.

wtr-state.description: Whether the hot-standby WTR timer is running.

switch-reason.description: The reason of hot-stanby LSP switch.

lsps.description: List of LSPs of a tunnel.

lsp.description: Statistics of LSP of a tunnel.

ingress-lsr-id.description: Ingress LSR ID.

tunnel-role.description: Specifies the types of the LSP nodes.

incoming-interface-name.description: LSP incoming interface name. The name is case-insensitive.

outgoing-interface-name.description: LSP outgoing interface name. The name is case-insensitive.

setup-priority.description: Setup priority of a LSP.

hold-priority.description: Hold priority of a LSP.

record-route.description: Route record mode.

dste-mode.description: Whether DS-TE is used for LSP bandwidth constraints.

explicit-path-name.description: Explicit path name of a LSP. The name is case-insensitive.

include-all.description: Specifies the Include-all (management group attribute) of a LSP.

include-any.description: Specifies the Include-any (management group attribute) of a LSP.

exclude-any.description: Specifies the Exclude-any (management group attribute) of a LSP.

local-protect-enable.description: Specifies the enabling or disabling state of FRR for a LSP.

local-protect-inuse.description: Specifies the FRR protection state of this LSP.

bypass-tunnel-name.description: Specifies the name of the bypass tunnel that protects the LSP. The name is case-insensitive.

permit-bandwidth-share.description: Indicates whether the LSP permits bandwidth sharing.

entropy-label.description: LSP Entropy Label Capability Negotiation Result.

ar-hops.description: List of actual path of a LSP.

ar-hop.description: Statistics of actual hop of a LSP.

incomming-type.description: Whether the hop is an inbound interface.

ip-address.description: IP address of the actual hop.

auto-bandwidths.description: Configure auto bandwidth configuration of a tunnel.

mode.description: Auto bandwidth mode.

threshold-percent.description: Set the threshold of the adjustment bandwidth.

threshold-absolute.description: Set the absolute minimum bandwidth of the adjustment bandwidth.

threshold-logic.description: Set thresholds to adjust the bandwidth of the threshold absolute value and percentage of the effective logic.

bit-error-detection.description: Configure bit error detection of LSP.

bit-error-switch.description: Enable/disable bit error detection switch capability.

detection-mode.description: Specifies the switch mode. Include unidirectional switching and bidirectional switching.

switch-threshold-coe-value.description: Specifies the coefficient value of switch-threshold.

switch-threshold-pow-value.description: Specifies the power value of switch-threshold.

resume-threshold-coe-value.description: Specifies the coefficient value of resume-threshold.

resume-threshold-pow-value.description: Specifies the power value of resume-threshold.

reverse-lsp.description: Configure reverse LSP of TE tunnel.

ingress-lsr-id.description: LSP id of a backward tunnel path.

tunnel-id.description: Session id of a backward tunnel.

ingress-lsr-id.description: Specifies ingress LSR ID of the tunnel.

admin-status.description: Interface administrative status. The available options are Up and Down.

oper-status.description: Interface operation status. The available options are Up and Down.

active-lsp-type.description: Type of LSP that is transmitting traffic.

working-lsp-id.description: The working LSP ID of a Tunnel.

current-collect-bandwith.description: Existing collected bandwidth in automatic bandwidth adjustment.

auto-bandwidth-remain-time.description: Remaining time of automatic bandwidth adjustment.

setup-priority.description:
Specifies a tunnel setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The setup priority of a tunnel must be equal to or smaller than its holding priority.

hold-priority.description:
Specifies a tunnel holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The holding priority of a tunnel must be equal to or larger than its setup priority.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

split-tunnel.description: Enable/disable an SR-TE tunnel as a split tunnel.

binding-sid.description: Working binding SID of a Tunnel.

reverse-binding-sid.description: The working reverse binding SID of a LSP.

adjacency-sid.description: Enable/disable SR-TE tunnel CSPF path select label type adjacency.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization of TE Tunnel.

hotstandby.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

wtr-time.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. Its range is 0~2592000, default is 10. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP overlap capability. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

lsp-paths.description: List of path configuration of a SR-TE tunnel.

lsp-path.description: Configure LSP path of a SR-TE tunnel. Two roles are available.

type.description: Path role of a tunnel. The available options are primary (used by primary LSP), hot-standby (used by hot-standby backup LSP).

explicit-path-name.description: Referenced explicit path by the tunnel. The name is case-insensitive.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a SR-MPLS TE LSP. If the default value (32) is used in the hop-limit, both adjacency and node SIDs can be used for local SR-MPLS TE path calculation. If a non-default value (1-31) is used in the hop-limit, only adjacency SIDs can be used for local SR-MPLS TE path computation.

lsp-id.description: LSP ID of a tunnel path.

modify-lsp-id.description: Modified LSP ID of a tunnel path.

include-all.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-all. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. The management attribute of a selected link must contain the entire Include-all attribute field of the tunnel.

include-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Include-any. The attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contain any bit in the Include-any attribute field of a LSP, the link can be a candidate LSP link.

exclude-any.description: Tunnel path management attribute: Exclude-any. The management attribute is a 32-bit vector. If the management attribute of a link contains any bit in the Exclude-any attribute field of a LSP, the link cannot be a candidate LSP link.

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

using-overlap.description: Whether the primary and HSB LSPs overlap.

switch-reason.description: The reason of hot-stanby LSP switch.
